frame.name: Being_in_captivity
frame.definition:
<def-root>A <fen>Theme</fen> is held in captivity by an <fen>Agent</fen> or <fen>Cause</fen>.
<ex><fex name="Theme">Twenty soldiers</fex> were <m>in</m> <t>captivity</t> for over a month before they were released</ex>
<ex>I never release <fex name="Agent">my</fex> <t><fex name="Theme">prisoners</fex></t>.</ex>
<ex>She couldn't believe <fex name="Theme">she</fex> was <t>prisoner</t> <fex name="Holding_location">in her own home</fex>.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Theme
FE.definition:
<def-root>The entity which is confined.
<ex><fex name="Thm">He</fex> was in <t>captivity</t> for six days.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Holding_location
FE.definition:
<def-root>The area within which the <fen>Theme</fen> is confined.
<ex>The <t>captives</t> <fex name="Holding_location">in the next room</fex> were fed well but otherwise ignored.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Agent
FE.definition:
<def-root>The <fen>Agent</fen> prevents the <fen>Theme</fen> from moving.
<ex>I would rather not remember being <fex name="Agt">their</fex> <t>captive</t>.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Reciprocation
FE.definition:
<def-root>The reason for the confinement.
<ex>He was our <t>prisoner</t> <fex name="Reciprocation">for betraying his superiors</fex>.</ex> </def-root>

FE.name: Place
FE.definition: <def-root>This FE identifies the general <fen>Place</fen> where the <fen>Theme</fen> is held captive. </def-root>

FE.name: Manner
FE.definition: <def-root>Any description of the state of being captive which is not covered by more specific FEs, including epistemic modification (probably, presumably, mysteriously), force (hard, softly), secondary effects (quietly, loudly), and general descriptions comparing events (the same way). It may also indicate salient characteristics of the <fen>Theme</fen>.</def-root>

FE.name: Explanation
FE.definition: <def-root>The reason for which the <fen>Theme</fen> is held captive.</def-root>

FE.name: Duration
FE.definition: <def-root>This FE identifies the <fen>Duration</fen> of time for which the <fen>Theme</fen> remains in captivity.</def-root>

FE.name: Cause
FE.definition: <def-root>An inanimate force which causes the <fen>Theme</fen> in be unable to move.</def-root>

lexUnit.name: captivity.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: a state of relative immobility caused by external forces.

lexUnit.name: prisoner.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: an individual in another's captivity.
